metadata.title: CVE-2021-32142 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in LibRaw linux/unix v0.20.0 allows attackerto escalate privileges via the LibRaw_buffer_datastream::gets(char*, int)in /src/libraw/src/libraw_datastream.cpp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.04.1
libraw20 - 0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.04.1').
darktable package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
rawtherapee package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
